# Dropships and Aircraft
These regulations govern the authority, modification and operational use of all aircraft and dropships.
## Flight Crew Authority - The Pilot(s) are responsible for their assigned aircraft and any modifications made to them. - Pilot(s) may modify their aircraft without requesting permission. - These modifications may not be overridden by the Commander. - Flight Crew have final authority over who is permitted aboard their aircraft. - Flight Crew may remove personnel of any rank from their aircraft for any reason.
## Aircraft Integrity - Dismantling aircraft components to obtain materials for other purposes is strictly forbidden. - Ship doors must remain intact at all times.
## Seating and Cargo - Seating capacity may be reduced to accommodate additional ammunition or cargo. - Seating may not be completely removed.
## Primary Transport Role - If a dropship becomes inaccessible or inoperable, another aircraft must assume the transport role. - The replacement aircraft must be configured with appropriate troop seating whenever possible.
## Parachute Operations - When conducting parachute drops, Flight Crew are responsible for: - Ensuring the drop zone is safe. - Notifying personnel when to deploy.
